data.title: Frankie Valli & The Four Seasons Tickets
data.meta_description: Frankie Valli & The Four Seasons on 30 November 2023 at Flagstar at Westbury Music Fair in Westbury, New York. Tickets available. Click here to find out more.
data.meta_site_name: Flagstar at Westbury Music Fair | Latest Events, Information & Tickets. Independent entertainment guide not affiliated with Live Nation. Not a box office.
data.text:
This summer, the legendary Frankie Valli and the Four Seasons are making their way to Westbury, New York! On Saturday, 3rd June 2023, they will be delivering an electrifying set packed with classic hits like “Can’t Take My Eyes off You,” “Big Girls Don’t Cry,” Walk Like a Man,” and more at the NYCB Theatre. This much-awaited show is part of Frankie Valli’s line-up of limited summer shows for 2023! The Rock and Roll Hall of Famers has been known to perform amazing live sets guaranteed to keep fans singing and dancing all night! If you’re a Frankie Valli fan, this is your chance to see the original Jersey Boy perform at the NYCB Theatre at Westbury!

Frankie Valli is a prolific singer who rose to prominence during the ‘60s. With the four seasons, Valli has released numerous Top 40 hits and four number 1 songs. Valli also released several solo singles and earned a couple of number 1 singles. He released his debut album with the Four Seasons in 1962. Sherry & 11 Others spawned the singles “Sherry” and “Big Girls Don’t Cry,” peaked at number 6 in the U.S. and entered the top 20 in the U.K. The same year, the group released a holiday album featuring several Christmas songs. The album peaked at number 13 on the Billboard 200. For the rest of the decade, the Four Seasons dropped a few number-1 hits like “Walk Like a Man” and “Rag Doll.”

In 1974, Valli released his solo number single, “My Eyes Adored You.” The song, written by Bob Crewe and Kenny Nolan, topped the Billboard Hot 100 and entered the charts in five other countries. Four years later, Valli released another number 1 hit single, “Grease,” which became the title track for the hit film of the same name. The double -platinum-certified song dominated the Billboard Hot 100 and entered the charts in 13 countries.

The Four Season’s incredible career has earned numerous accolades. In 1990, the band and Valli were inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. Nine years later, the group was inducted into the Vocal Group Hall of Fame.

Catch Franki Vallie and the Four Seasons as they light up the NYCB Theatre in Westbury, New York, on Saturday 3rd June 2023! Tickets are now available!
